item.title: Parliament Winter Session Live: Nehru jailed Majrooh Sultanpuri, Balraj Sahni, says Sitharaman - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Parliament Winter Session Live: Cong MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra demands restoration of '71 war photo

Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

During the Winter Session of Parliament, Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra raised the issue of restoring a historic photo from the 1971 war, emphasizing the need to acknowledge the sacrifices of Indian soldiers.

  • The final week of the Winter Session features debates on key constitutional issues.
  • The government is likely to defer the constitutional amendment bill for simultaneous elections.
  • Priyanka Gandhi highlighted the bravery of soldiers and the leadership of Indira Gandhi during the 1971 conflict.
‚ÄúI want to salute the brave soldiers who fought for us in the war of 1971,‚Äù said Priyanka Gandhi.

The discussions reflect ongoing tensions regarding historical narratives and national memory within Indian politics.

item.title: NSA Ajit Doval Likely To Visit China For Special Representative Talks: Sources - News18
item.description:
NSA Ajit Doval Set to Visit China for Key Talks

Date: December 16, 2024

Source: News18

National Security Advisor Ajit Doval is expected to visit China soon for Special Representative talks, according to sources.

  • The visit comes after External Affairs Minister Dr. S Jaishankar discussed India-China relations in Parliament.
  • Jaishankar highlighted improvements in bilateral ties and full disengagement in eastern Ladakh.
  • He remarked on the ongoing diplomatic engagements that have set the stage for better Indo-China ties.
  • India and China have faced military tensions since May 2020 due to confrontations in the Galwan Valley.
‚ÄúRecent developments that reflect continuous diplomatic engagements have set Indo-China ties in the direction of some improvement,‚Äù said Jaishankar.

The upcoming talks are seen as a crucial step in consolidating progress in India-China relationships following prolonged military standoffs.

item.title: Love avocados? They have these surprising side effects - Firstpost
item.description:
The Surprising Side Effects of Eating Too Many Avocados

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Firstpost

This article discusses various side effects that can occur from consuming avocados in excess, despite their many health benefits.

  • Allergic reactions: Individuals with latex allergies may have reactions similar to avocado consumption.
  • Weight gain: Due to high fat content, overeating avocados can lead to weight gain.
  • Gastrointestinal issues: Excessive amounts can cause bloating or diarrhea due to high fiber.
  • High potassium levels: Overconsumption may lead to hyperkalemia, affecting heart health.
  • Medication interference: Can interact with blood thinners due to vitamin K content.
  • Nutrient imbalance: Dominating one's diet with avocados may crowd out other nutrients.
  • Heartburn or acid reflux: Some may experience reflux symptoms post-consumption.
  • Skin issues: Increased skin oiliness or breakouts can occur for some individuals.
  • Environmental concerns: High demand has led to deforestation and unsustainable practices.
‚ÄúAvocados may interact with medications like blood thinners because of their vitamin K content.‚Äù

In conclusion, while avocados are nutrient-rich, moderation is key to avoiding negative side effects.

item.title: Congress Reacts After Omar Abdullah Junks Opposition's EVM Charge - NDTV
item.description:
Congress Reacts After Omar Abdullah Junks Opposition's EVM Charge

Publication Date: December 16, 2024   Source: NDTV

The Congress party has criticized ally Omar Abdullah's stance on opposition issues, particularly regarding recent allegations of manipulation of Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs), after Abdullah dismissed these claims.

  • Omar Abdullah's party, the National Conference, contested the Jammu and Kashmir elections alongside the Congress.
  • Congress parliamentarian Manickam Tagore highlighted differing views on EVMs among opposition parties following recent elections.
  • Recent opposition claims regarding EVM discrepancies were led by Sharad Pawar's NCP and Shiv Sena (UBT).
  • Congress's Working Committee has accused the Election Commission of partisan conduct and hinted at targeted manipulation.
  • Abdullah stated that political parties doubting EVMs should refrain from participating in elections.
Mr. Abdullah stated, "When you get a hundred plus members of parliament using the same EVMs, and you celebrate that... you can't... turn around and say... we don't like these EVMs because now the election results aren't going the way we would like them to."

The debate over EVM integrity showcases significant differences within the opposition and raises questions about electoral processes in India.

item.title: Parliament Winter Session Day 17 LIVE Updates: Congress only made Amendments in Constitution to help the dynasty, says FM in RS; Priyanka Gandhi raises concern over human-animal conflict - The Hindu
item.description:
Parliament Winter Session Day 17 LIVE Updates: Congress only made Amendments in Constitution to help the dynasty, says FM in RS; Priyanka Gandhi raises concern over human-animal conflict

Date: December 16, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The Parliament session on December 16, 2024, saw significant discussions on constitutional amendments and challenges faced by citizens due to human-animal conflicts.

  • Congress MP Manickam Tagore raised an adjournment motion regarding the removal of a historical 1971 war photograph from Army HQ.
  • Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman criticized Congress for amending the Constitution to protect political interests rather than strengthen democracy.
  • Priyanka Gandhi highlighted the plight of citizens affected by wild animal attacks, specifically mentioning nearly 90 incidents in Wayanad.
  • Sanjay Raut emphasized the government's actions counter to the Constitution during his speech in the Rajya Sabha.
  • Debates continued around the historical significance of the Constitution and its ongoing relevance in contemporary politics.
‚ÄúAmendments were not about strengthening democracy but protecting those in power,‚Äù Nirmala Sitharaman in Rajya Sabha.

This session reflects ongoing tensions between political parties regarding governance and public safety, emphasizing the need for urgent dialogue on these pressing issues.

Date: Dec 16, 2024, Source: ESPN

Amad Diallo's exceptional performance led Manchester United to a thrilling victory against Manchester City, highlighted by a magical strike that secured the win in the Manchester derby.

  • Diallo displayed his relentless energy and skill throughout the match.
  • He won a penalty that was converted by Bruno Fernandes to equalize the game.
  • In the dying moments, Diallo scored the winning goal with a remarkable finish.
  • His captain, Fernandes, praised Diallo for his vital contributions.
‚ÄúHe showed again today he is always alive... He has been brilliant. When he is like this he is unstoppable.‚Äù - Bruno Fernandes

This performance marks a significant moment in Diallo's career as he cements his place in the starting lineup under new coach Ruben Amorim.

item.title: Zakir Hussain: Legendary tabla player dies at 73 - BBC.com
item.description:
Zakir Hussain: Legendary Tabla Player Dies at 73

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: News Agency

Zakir Hussain, one of the world's greatest tabla players, has died at the age of 73 due to idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.

  • Hussain was a four-time Grammy award winner and received the Padma Vibhushan.
  • He transformed the tabla into a globally loved solo instrument.
  • Tributes have started pouring in following his death.
  • Nayan Ghosh described him as a pathbreaker and an icon who elevated tabla on the world stage.
‚ÄúHe was a pathbreaker, a game-changer, an icon who put tabla and Indian music on the world map...‚Äù - Nayan Ghosh

This legendary musician, born in Mumbai in 1951, has left an indelible mark on classical music.

item.title: Vishal Mega Mart IPO allotment to be finalised today: Steps to check status on BSE, NSE, KFin Tech - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Vishal Mega Mart IPO Allotment Finalized Today: Steps to Check Status on BSE, NSE, KFin Tech

Date & Source: Dec 16, 2024 IST, CNBC TV18

Supermarket chain Vishal Mega Mart is set to finalize the allotment of its initial public offering (IPO) today. The company's shares are scheduled to debut on the BSE and NSE on December 18.

  • The IPO was open for subscription from December 11 to 13 and received a total subscription of 27.28 times.
  • The price band was set at ‚Çπ74-78 per share.
  • Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIBs) subscribed 80.75 times the shares reserved for them.
  • The non-institutional investors' portion was subscribed 14.24 times, while the retail portion was subscribed 2.31 times.
  • Allotted shares will be credited to demat accounts by December 17, and refunds for unsuccessful bids will also be initiated the same day.
  • Vishal Mega Mart raised ‚Çπ2,400 crore from anchor investors before the IPO.
  • Established in 2001, Vishal Mega Mart operates 645 stores across 414 cities in India.
‚ÄúAllotted shares will be credited to the applicants' demat accounts.‚Äù

This IPO is a significant step for Vishal Mega Mart as they continue to cater to middle- and lower-middle-income groups across India.

item.title: Study Says Flu Virus Remains In Refrigerated Raw Milk For Up To 5 Days - NDTV Food
item.description:
Flu Virus Found to Survive in Refrigerated Raw Milk for Up to 5 Days

Publication Date: August 29, 2024
Source: NDTV

A recent study from Stanford University reveals that the influenza virus can remain infectious in refrigerated raw milk for up to five days, raising concerns amid outbreaks of bird flu.

  • The flu virus H1N1 PR8 can survive in raw milk at refrigeration temperatures.
  • More than 14 million Americans consume raw milk annually, which is marketed as a healthier alternative to pasteurized milk.
  • The FDA has linked raw milk to over 200 illness outbreaks, highlighting significant health risks.
  • Flu virus RNA can remain detectable in raw milk for at least 57 days, posing challenges for food safety assessments.
  • Monitoring systems need improvement as bird flu spreads among livestock.
‚ÄúThis work highlights the potential risk of avian influenza transmission through consumption of raw milk and the importance of milk pasteurization.‚Äù - Alexandria Boehm, Senior Author

The findings of this research emphasize significant health risks associated with raw milk consumption, particularly in light of ongoing bird flu infections in cattle.

item.title: Bengaluru executive suicide: Atul Subhash's wife Nikita Singhania was living as paying guest in Gurgaon - The Times of India
item.description:

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Times of India

The article discusses the tragic suicide of a Bengaluru executive, Atul Subhash, and how his wife, Nikita Singhania, is now living as a paying guest in Gurgaon, facing the aftermath of this loss.

  • Atul Subhash, a Bengaluru executive, has died by suicide.
  • His wife, Nikita Singhania, is coping with the situation by living as a paying guest in Gurgaon.
  • The article sheds light on the challenges faced by families of suicide victims.
‚ÄúThis incident raises concerns about mental health and support systems available for individuals dealing with such crises.‚Äù

The suicide of Atul Subhash highlights the critical importance of mental health awareness and support for families in distress.

item.title: Bangladesh To Hold Elections In Late 2025 Or Early 2026: Muhammad Yunus - NDTV
item.description:
Bangladesh To Hold Elections In Late 2025 Or Early 2026: Muhammad Yunus

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: NDTV

Bangladesh's interim leader Muhammad Yunus announced on Monday that general elections are expected to be held in late 2025 or early 2026 following a challenging political transition.

  • Yunus was appointed as chief adviser after a student-led uprising that ousted former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina.
  • The interim government is facing pressure to establish a date for the elections amid calls for democratic reforms.
  • Yunus highlighted the need for electoral reforms before the elections can be scheduled.
  • The former prime minister, Hasina, fled to neighboring India amid protests against her rule, which was marked by allegations of human rights abuses.
  • Yunus hinted that elections could be moved up to November 2025 if parties agree to minimal reforms.
‚ÄúThroughout, I have emphasised that reforms should take place first before the arrangements for an election,‚Äù Muhammad Yunus stated.

The future of democracy in Bangladesh hangs in the balance as reforms are debated prior to the elections, which may shape the political landscape of the country.

item.title: 5 stunning images of our solar system captured by NASA Hubble Space Telescope - HT Tech
item.description:
5 Stunning Images of Our Solar System Captured by NASA Hubble Space Telescope

Publication Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: HT TECH

The article explores five stunning images of our solar system captured by the NASA Hubble Space Telescope, showcasing celestial wonders and interesting facts about our cosmic neighborhood.

  • Our solar system is approximately 4.5 billion years old.
  • Only two NASA spacecraft have exited our solar system.
  • Experts estimate there are about 500,000 pieces of space junk orbiting Earth.
  • Alien aurorae on Uranus are caused by solar winds and moon volcanism.
  • Hubble captured auroras on Jupiter and Saturn, providing unique insights into their atmospheres.
‚ÄúHubble Telescope captured this image of the planet Mars in 2018. This high-resolution image was more powerful than the spacecraft that visited the planet.‚Äù

In conclusion, the images captured by the Hubble Space Telescope not only highlight the beauty of our solar system but also enhance our understanding of its complexity and the mysteries that lie beyond.

item.title: Delhi shivers amid coldwave conditions as minimum drops to 4.5¬∞C; AQI ‚Äòvery poor‚Äô - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi Coldwave: Minimum Temperature Falls to 4.5¬∞C Amid 'Very Poor' Air Quality

Date: Dec 16, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Coldwave conditions continue to grip Delhi, with a recorded minimum temperature of 4.5¬∞C, marking the joint lowest this season.

  • Minimum temperature recorded at Safdarjung dropped to 4.5¬∞C, four degrees below normal.
  • Shallow fog resulted in visibility of around 800 metres.
  • Air quality index (AQI) reached 'very poor' levels, averaging 351.
  • Experts link the deterioration in AQI to a drop in wind speed; similar conditions expected to persist.
  • Lowest minimum temperature was recorded at 3.5¬∞C in Pusa and 4¬∞C in Ayanagar.
‚ÄúA feeble western disturbance is beginning to impact northwest India, which is slowing down winds. This should keep the AQI likely in the very poor range.‚Äù - Mahesh Palawat, Skymet

The coldwave is set to continue, with temperatures predicted to hover around 5¬∞C on Tuesday.
